reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy Read; It sucks you in!
reviews.reviewText: The story started out a little slow but once you get past the first chapter it gets better. It was nice getting to know the characters from such a young age and then see how they ended up as adults. The main heroine had such a tough decision and I don't know what I would have done in her shoes.I tried to put myself in her shoes but unless you are in that position for reals, it's hard to really know what you would do. I kept thinking about Castaway, with Tom Hanks, and how things ended for him in that movie as well. It's not easy.I definitely cried multiple times (but I am a crybaby) and was invested.All in all, I liked it. This author does a good job with the stories and painting a picture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’m hurting. This book gave me very strong emotions! My heart broke in two, but felt….oddly at peace at the end! It was a great read and I highly recommend! Beautifully written.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I recently started reading again after a long break and honestly this was the first book I picked up and it just reminded me why I love reading so much. The story and the characters absolutely stole my heart, I don’t want to give too much away so do yourself the favor and read it for yourself. I sobbed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Try some of her other books...
reviews.reviewText: Format: Audible/Paperback/Kindle⭐⭐⭐Enjoyed, would recommend🌶️ Rating: 1This is my 6th Taylor Jenkins Reid book, and it is a rounded 3 for me. I’d say more of a 2.5ish.I think the problem is I know the power of Reid’s talent, and it just did not shine through in this book. It’s not a bad book, it’s not a bad story. Did it grip me, not really. Throughout my reading journey I kept forgetting the name of the book.The characters are cute, the storyline seems rushed. I definitely did not give me “all the feels” like I’m use to with her books. It’s a fast read for sure, but you can skip this one and try The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo or Daisy Jones & The Six.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I have found that I really enjoy TJR’s style of writing so I’ve been trying to read through her list of books. This one doesn’t disappoint. It starts off telling you the story from a teenage point of view when she meets and falls in love with her eventual husband. Then you read about their marriage and how he eventually goes missing on a work trip. He’s gone for 3+ years and you hear a lot about her grief and how she tried to get through it. Eventually she takes a chance on an old dorky highschoool friend and ends up getting engaged to him. Then the husband miraculously comes back and she’s faced with deciding between the two.The good stuff:1. The writing about grief was excellent, even if you haven’t lived through a loved one dying or going missing, most people have experienced grief and the description was spot on.2. The love story of how she met her husband was sweet and it immediately transported me back to highschool crushes and best friends that you think matter more than family.3. The relationship with her parents was great - they were supportive even when they didn’t understand her choices and welcomed her back when she needed them.The not so good stuff:1. She had a strained relationship with her sister for seemingly no real reason which was a recurring theme but didn’t have much substance.2. The husbands survival story was so ridiculous and implausible it was comical. They also only discussed what he actually went through for like 1 paragraph…. This was the major pivotal moment… wish it had been better thought out and described. Wish we could have heard his point of view.3. The book focuses heavily on how a person can fundamentally change after a tragedy.. but I seriously doubt a girl who was desperate to travel the world, moved across the country, and married a trouble making jock, would suddenly decide she wants to move back home permanently, run a small family store, and marry the band geek from her highschool. That sounds like a rebound move while picking up the pieces… not how she would permanently shape the rest of her life.4. I personally think she picked the wrong guy in the end (don’t come for me on this). I think her decision will leave her unhappy and bored in the long run. To be fair, I think the best ending of all would have been her picking herself and starting her life fresh over going back to traveling and writing. I loved the sister telling her it wasn’t about the men, she had to figure out herself. Wish they had stuck to that theme!In sum, it’s the typical good read by TJR but I wish the ending had been better with the main tragedy better thought out and addressed. Maybe one day she will write a book from Jesse’s POV or Marie’s POV and I would love to read those!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: There aren't too many books that truly move me and resonate with me, but this book is an exception. It's such a beautiful story, I read an ebook version and loved the book so much that I had to get myself the actual printed version! This is easily my favorite book of Taylor's and I've read all of them. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wow, this book takes your heart and tears it into pieces but also rebuilds it. It follows Emma, a girl who marries her high school sweetheart and travels the world with him until one fateful day he is in a helicopter crash and presumed dead. We follow her as she navigates the grieving process and eventually as she finds new love. But what happens when her first love has returned? Who will she choose?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars One Life, Two Loves
reviews.reviewText: I had heard so much about Taylor Jenkins Reid’s books, but I had never read one. One True Loves introduces us to Emma Blair. Her first crush, Jesse Lerner, becomes her first love, but tragedy strikes and the two are separated. Everyone believes he is dead, and after years of grief, Emma decides to move on. She rekindles a relationship with an old acquaintance and the two fall in love and plan to be married. Then the unthinkable happens, and Emma learns that Jesse is in fact alive and is returning to her. Does Emma choose her old love or her new? I enjoyed the conflict, but there were times I found the dialogue somewhat shallow, and towards the end, I found myself skipping over passages that were too repetitive. So I rated the book 4 stars, or probably 3 1/2 to be honest.
Llegó muy bien, el libro es genial
Um livro que te da um dilmea e que junto com a protagonista vc vai percebendo o caminho certo

reviews.reviewTitle: This book is my one true love

reviews.reviewText: Emma se casa con su amor de juventud, Jesse, y se construyen una vida a medida, alejada de las expectativas de su familia. En su primer aniversario, Jesse recibe un encargo y, mientras sobrevuela el Pacífico, su helicóptero desaparece. Emma regresa a su hogar para recomponerse. Años después, vuelve a enamorarse y, cuando se compromete, encuentran a Jesse, que lleva todo ese tiempo vivo e intentando volver a casa. Emma tiene ahora un marido y un prometido, ¿pero quién es su verdadero amor?Gracias a esta relectura he vuelto a conectar con la autora. One true loves es una novela muy ligera que me ha hecho empatizar un montón con la Emma adolescente, sus inseguridades y cómo vive sus amores de instituto. Es una historia muy corta, pero que te hace sentir de todo de forma muy intensa. Mucha gente encuentra el (los) romance algo escaso y necesitado de desarrollo. Personalmente, para mí ganan todas las emociones de Emma a lo largo del libro: su situación no te dejará indiferente, es más, te llevará por delante de forma arrolladora y sin contemplaciones. Por segunda vez, Taylor ha conseguido tenerme con el corazón en un puño, reír y llorar en unas pocas páginas. Si hay algo a lo que aspiro es a tener una relación tan sana y bonita como. Las que tiene Emma a lo largo de la novela, alguien que me quiera tanto y con quien poder hablar de todo. De nuevo, el estilo de la autora es muy sencillo si quieres empezar a leer en inglés, y en esta ocasión sí he sentido que se ha salido de los libros que suele escribir. Nuestra protagonista no es especialmente guapa y no encaja en lo que todo el mundo espera de ella, al contrario que Daisy o Evelyn; Emma me ha parecido mucho más real y accesible, alguien con quien cualquiera puede identificarse. Es posible que One true loves se cuele entre mis mejores lecturas de este 2024.
I loved reading the book. It caught me and I definitely recommend reading the book. Emotinal storywith a lot of depth.
